page.title: 04HOUSING
page.content: 168 houses are permanently occupied and there are 35 holiday or second homes and 9 houses for sale. 42 peo- ple live alone. Most houses are owner occupied. At Wearhead a few houses were built between the wars and several since, including a small brick built Council Estate with 4 Old People's bungalows. 2 houses faced with stone have recently been built at Ireshopeburn but most houses are at least 150 years old. The farm at Low Burn is dated 1605. Houses are gener- ally well cared for, many having been improved with the aid of council grants. Farm buildings have been used for extensions to adjoining houses and for conversion into dwellings or garages. Gardens are well kept. Flow- ers, vegetables and soft fruit are grown and some households have green- houses.
